result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Burrow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all treatment recommendations  as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing; testing is to occur not less once per month for the first six months after release from the conditional jail term
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to undergo a Certified Batterers Intervention assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment
--contact with Corena Pierce is to occur only after completion of the Batterers' Intervention Assessment and only with approval by Ms. Pierce along with approval by the Agent
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence toward any person
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes  as approved by the Agent, and except for incidental contact as necessary during incarceration and for employment and educational programming, as approved by the Agent
--to reimburse Jefferson County for court-appointed attorney fees

Arresting Agency: FAPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Case called at 11:35 am [sf]
Defendant Mark A. Burrow in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Jessie Phelps appears for the Department of Corrections.

ADA Hall advises that the State has victim compliance.
Agent Phelps provides information to the Court regarding concerns for when the defendant is released, Department is hoping to have until early february to finalize a plan for the defendant's release
Agent Phelps requests an ATR and that be up through the first part of Febuary. 

Defendant makes a statement to the Court, believes that he has been in custody long enough.
Court will not amend JOC as to the no contact. 
Court grants DOC request for conditional jail time. Court orders 41 days conditional jail with commencement retro active back to 12/14/15.

recess: 11:46 am
Probation review hearing at 01-11-2016 11:30 am

Case called at 11:25 am
Defendant Mark A. Burrow in custody. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Jesse Phelps appears for the Department of Corrections.

ADA Hall advises that the Notice of Hearing indicated 1/5/17. The State has attempted to make contact with the victim but has not been sucsessful. 
ADA Hall requests for an adjournment.
Agent Phelps advises that the defendant has completed the original conditional jail term, defendant has begun to comply with some of the things mentioned in the letter to the Court.

Court will adjourn to allow the State time to contact the victim.
Court advises the jail that the defendant may appear by telephone.
Court indicates to Agent Phelps and the Defendant that if they can work something out to put it in writing and the Court will review it.

recess: 11:29 am
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Probation Review Hearing: 1/11/16 at 11:30 am
Court orders a hearing be set on DOC letter received 12/11/15
Probation review hearing at 01-05-2017 11:00 am

cases #  6:46am. [MK]
Defendant Mark A. Burrow in court with Attorney C Bennett Penwell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of the Amended Information in case #14CF269 admitted; reading waived.  The amendment is only as to the physical descriptors for Mr. Burrow.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty  " entered in Case #14CF33 on Count #1, in Case #14CF103 on Count #1, on Case #14CF269 on Counts #1, #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Hall submits the victim impact statement in case #14CF269); the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Burrow guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On agreement of the parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #14CF33 on Counts #2, #3, #4;  Case #14CF103 on Count #2, on Case #14CF269 on Counts #3, #4, #5.

---------------------------
In Case #14CF103, the Court sentences Mr. Burrow  to  6  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  
The Court finds that Mr. Burrow is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Burrow is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  10  days credit for time already served.
The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Burrow on Probation for 4 years. 
 ---------------------------
In Case #14CF33, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Burrow on Probation for 2 years.  There are 9 days credit for time already served. 
----------------------------
In Case #14CF269, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Burrow on Probation for 3 years.  There are 9 days credit for time already served. 
----------------------------


Conditions of Probation on all three cases are:  
--on Case #14CF33 only:  to serve 12 months in the Jefferson County, with work release; to commence forthwith 
--Mr. Burrow is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; any prescription controlled substances are not to exceed the therapeutic level;  non-compliance will result in loss of Work-Release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all treatment recommendations as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing; testing is to occur not less once per month for the first six months after release from the conditional jail term
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to undergo a Certified Batterers Intervention assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment
--contact with Corena Pierce is to occur only after completion of the Batterers' Intervention Assessment and only with approval by Ms. Pierce along with approval by the Agent
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence toward any person
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by the Agent, and except for incidental contact as necessary during incarceration and for employment and educational programming, as approved by the Agent
--to reimburse Jefferson County for court-appointed attorney fees
--in Cases #14CF33 and #14CF103 only:  to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--in Case #14CF 33: to pay costs of $268, plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $25 in drug testing fees
--in Case #14CF103: to pay costs of $268, plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $100 in controlled drug buy funds, plus 50 in drug testing fees
--in Case #14CF269 on Count #1:  to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge
--in Case #14CF269 on Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge

from DA Happ re: filing of amended information
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2014 at 09:30 am.

cases #14CF33, #14CF103, #14CF269 called at 8:34am. [MK]
Defendant Mark A. Burrow in court with Attorney Charles B Penwell.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
------------
In Case #14CF269, Mr. Burrow waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial. 
Arraignment held in Case #14CF269:  Service of the Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited. Pleas of "not guilty" entered on all counts. 
-----------
Attorney Penwell requests the scheduling of a Plea/Sentencing hearing in mid to late January-- some delay is needed for Mr. Burrow to seek an assessment that is connected to the offer in this case. 
The Court informs the parties that these cases will transfer to Branch III/Judge Wambach as of January 1st. 
Attorney Penwell indicates that the Defense intends to request substitution of Judge Wambach.
recess 8:42am. 

NEXT:  cases referred to Branch III for further scheduling (parties request the scheduling of a plea/sentencing hearing on all three cases in late January, however the Defense intends to file for substitution of Branch III)
Consent to Act endorsed by Counsel
Pre-trial conference on November 12, 2014 at 02:20 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

cases #14CF33, #14CF103, #14CF269 called at 8:33am. [MK]
Defendant Mark A. Burrow in court with Attorney C. Bennett Penwell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney David Westrick is present for the purpose of verifying that he has a conflict as the City of Fort Atkinson 
The Court allows Attorney Westrick to withdraw as counsel.  The Court affirms its appointment of  Attorney Penwell as counsel on all three cases. The Court verifies with Mr. Burrow that he understands that he will be required to reimburse the attorney fee cost 
Attorney Penwell provides the current address of Mr. Burrow because he is now living at his mother's home:  N1093 Old Hwy. 26, Fort Atkinson WI.
Case #14CF269 is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, however Attorney Penwell requests adjournment because he was just appointed as counsel on October 30th. The Defense is waiving the Preliminary Hearing time limits in Case #14CF269. 
The Court adjourns
recess 9:38am. 

(1) Pretrial Conference on November 12th at 2:20pm.  (2) schedule Cases #14CF33 and#14CF103 for Status Conference, and reschedule Case #14CF269 for Preliminary Hearing, all on same date and time approximately two weeks after the Pretrial date

Attorney De La Rosa advises that the defendant now qualifies for SPD representation.
Court orders Attorney Westrick discharged from 14CF33 & 14CF103, Court advises the defendant that he will still be responsible for the Court Appointed Attorney fees for Attorney Westrick.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviews that Judge Weston previously found probable cause.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.
Attorney Flint motions the Court for forfeiture of the signature bonds in 14CF103 & 14CF33.
Court finds the bond in default and orders it be forfeited.

-No contact with Corena Pierce, Rick Ratcliff or Riley Wiese

14CF269: Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF33, #14CF103, #14CF269 called at 8:55am.
Defense Attorney David R. Westrick in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court indicates that it is ordering issuance of Bench Warrants, however because of concerns regarding confusion related to mailings Attorney Westrick's office sent Mr. Burrow, the Court will include a provision that Mr. Burrow may post $100 cash bail and be given a new hearing date, in lieu of arrest. Such a hearing date is to be within five days of Mr. Burrow posting the cash bail. 

The Court notes that, at the appearance on the warrants:  
--in cases #14CF33 & #14CF103, a Status Conference is needed including on whether it is in Mr. Burrow's best interest to have Attorney Westrick continue to represent him when Attorney Westrick now has a conflict as to the newly pending case #14CF269, and also on these two cases, the State's Motion to Modify Bond pends.
-in case #14CF269 an Initial Appearance is needed (an amendment of Complaint is needed to correct demographics) 
recess 8:59am.
--[Post-Hearing/Off-Record the Court indicates to the clerk and DA Happ (Attorney Westrick has exited the courtroom) that the warrants are only issued in cases #14CF33 and #14CF103; there has not been service in case #14CF269.]
Copy of Criminal Complaint
Initial appearance on August 8, 2014 at 08:45 am.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF33 and #14CF103 and #14CF269 called at 9:35am. 
Attorney David R. Westrick in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Westrick explains that Defendant Mark Burrow likely does not appear because Attorney Westrick's staff sent Mr. Burrow a letter about Attorney Westrick having a scheduling conflict for today's court date.  The letter referenced a new hearing date of August 8th at 8:45am.  However there have been changes in Attorney Westrick's schedule, and also DA Happ has indicated that the State wanted today's hearing to remain on the calendar due to new Felony Bailjumping allegations in newly-filed case #14CF269.
Attorney Westrick indicates that he can only communicate with Mr. Burrow by mail because Mr. Burrow's phone has been disconnected. 
The Court re-raises a concern regarding Attorney Westrick's ability to serve as court-appointed counsel in these cases, especially now that the new case #14CF269 involves the Fort Atkinson Police Department.  Attorney Westrick indicates that he will not be able to represent Mr. Burrow in the newest case. 

After discussion with counsel, the Court reschedules the hearing to August 8th at 8:45, indicating that the Court will mail notices today to Mr. Burrow, and that the notices will include wording that instructs Mr. Burrow to disregard any notification received previously from Attorney Westrick's office, and clarifying that Mr. Burrow must personally appear at the hearing. 
ADA Hall informs the Court and Defense that the State's previous plea offer is now withdrawn. 
recess 9:39am. 

NEXT:  Schedule all three cases for hearing on August 8th at 8:45am.; the notice is to include wording that instructs Mr. Burrow to disregard any court-date notification received previously from Attorney Westrick's office and emphasizing in bold printing that Mr. Burrow must appear personally at the hearing;  
--cases #14CF33 & #14CF103 will be Status Conference and Motion Hearing on State's Motion to Modify Bond (JA- note in comments that attorney conflict concerns need to be addressed and inquiry made whether Mr. Burrow may now qualify for PD representation) 
--case #14CF269 will be Initial Appearance (JA- please note in comments that amendment of Complaint is needed to correct demographics)
